Address: 1506 N Maple Rd, Ann Arbor, MI 48103
Description: Cozy breakfast & lunch nook with vegetarian, vegan & gluten-free options, plus smoothies & espresso.

summary.snippet: "Their apology was to offer me an energy ball for the wait and the trip home."
"Good selection of breakfast and lunch options including vegan."

most_relevant.description:
After returning for our second visit in a year, I can confidently say that The Juicy Kitchen is one of the best brunch spots we've tried in MI. From the food to the service and hospitality, everything is exceptional.
The owner, who greeted us warmly, is incredibly welcoming and communicative. The staff members are friendly, warm, and extremely helpful. Words can't quite capture how wonderful this place is. Don't be surprised by its small size and tucked-away location in a plaza, it's truly a hidden gem in Ann Arbor!

Refreshing, authentic & quality food.
We’ll be regulars here when in town.
Definitely better then continental or regular classic breakfast.
The products are organic and produce are fresh.
They have gluten free options!!!

We recently visited for breakfast and the food is incredible. Fresh and healthy. My wife had a breakfast burrito and I had one of their specials. There is limited seating but they do offer takeout which appears to be very popular here. If your in the area give this place a try. You will not be sorry.

I was happy with finding vegan options in this part of town during our visit. We tried a few dishes, including the vegan burrito, hot mess, southwestern hash, and slider (vegan). For the vegan versions, they replace egg with tempeh and the cheese with spicy mayo. Overall, the vegan options were okay, but did not seem their specialty. Also al of the dishes had a spicy sauce I wasn’t a fan of. The vegan baked goods were good though and highly recommend the coffee over the chai.

The food was amazing, the atmosphere was wonderful, people tripping over others to be nice, and not just the staff. It's food that puts everyone in a good mood. I wish it was larger, because there was a solid line from the register to the door all the time I was there. When I went back to Ann Arbor, I was really sad that they were closed that day.

I went for a brunch after a long hike in winter.
Hot chocolate felt awesome after the cold. We tried Vegan dishes and they were delicious. Quinoa dish, veggie burger and veggie breakfast burrito we loved them all. It’s a small place with a nice vibe and many healthy food options including ready to go sandwiches, soups etc. (don’t have food pictures)

I’ve been meaning to try this place for a while, and I finally found a good time to grab some breakfast. The people working there are so warm. They have so many delicious and healthy options. You feel like you’re paying for quality food. I especially loved their breakfast burritos, and their overnight oats were a hefty portion loaded with tons of good stuff. Flavorful and made with care. Far better breakfast fare than I can usually find on a busy morning. I think I’ll become a regular!

Amazing experience. I was in Ann Arbor picking up materials for a job site. I hadn’t eaten lunch yet so I decided to find something close to my route and juicy kitchen is what I found.  When I walked in I was instantly greeted by one of the employees. he did an amazing job helping me choose something since this was my first time in the restaurant. Any questions I had were not only answered by him but also by the extremely friendly staff in the back area. While I was ordering I noticed that someone was cleaning and organizing at all times. As a business owner myself to see employees that actually cared about their workplace made me smile. I ordered the breakfast burrito with chicken sausage and a strawberry orange mango smoothie. I’ll start with the smoothie. I’ve had a lot of smoothies in my life but this was definitely one of the best. You could taste the real fruit not like other places that use concentrates. It was very creamy cold and refreshing. I could’ve told you about the food in the beginning but what would a story be without a little suspense. Usually when you go into a smaller restaurant everyone has their spin on a breakfast burrito and nine times out of 10 they always put way too many ingredients. but not the juicy kitchen. It was the perfect sized burrito. not too big to where every bite everything falls apart and not too small that it didn’t fill me up. All the ingredients inside the burrito perfectly accented all the other ingredients and it was the perfect portion of each ingredient that you’re able to taste all the flavors and enjoy it. Nothing overpowered anything else. Overall for my experience I would give this place a 10 out of 10 very happy and pleased with the service greatly enjoyed the food and the staff and I will definitely be back the next time I am in the area.
